name: Marcus Rodriguez
bio: Bootcamp instructor and workshop facilitator. 3 years teaching experience. High-energy, hands-on teaching style. Former software engineer who discovered a passion for teaching.

strengths.notes: Naturally draws students into conversation, reads the room well
Thrives when plans go sideways, can generate activities on the fly
Students love him, creates a safe and energetic learning environment
Comfortable running pair programming, small groups, and whole-class activities

growth_areas.notes: Knows Python data analysis at a practical level but not academic depth — advanced statistical questions can trip him up
Consistently runs over time, especially on hands-on sections where he lets students explore
Sometimes jumps between concepts without clear scaffolding

python-data-analysis.notes: Solid on pandas basics and data cleaning, weaker on advanced aggregation and statistical methods

lecture.notes: Keeps lectures very short, often shorter than planned

discussion.notes: Discussions run long because he's good at them and enjoys them

hands_on.notes: Consistently runs 5 min over on hands-on exercises — needs pre-shortened allocations

growth_nudges: For advanced aggregation topics, consider including detailed talking points in the plan — your facilitation is strong enough to carry the content even when it's scripted
Try setting a visible timer for hands-on exercises — your instinct to let students explore is good but the sessions consistently run over
